description: The single Frontend Developer is a critical bottleneck and single point of failure. Any illness, departure, or underestimation of task complexity will directly delay the project timeline.
mitigation_strategy: Immediately hire one contract Senior Frontend Developer for the project duration (8-10 weeks).
contingency_plan: De-scope non-essential UI features. Initiate cross-training with a backend developer, accepting a 50% productivity loss on their tasks.
monitoring_trigger: Any frontend task slipping by more than 2 days.
resolution_timeline: 2 weeks to source and onboard contractor.

description: A flaw in the Jint sandbox configuration allows a malicious script to bypass constraints, leading to arbitrary code execution on the server or a Denial of Service (DoS) attack.
mitigation_strategy: Implement dedicated security code reviews for all Jint-related code. Use static analysis tools to flag risky code patterns. Maintain a suite of negative tests that try to break the sandbox.
contingency_plan: Utilize the system-wide feature flag to immediately disable the data transformation feature in production if a vulnerability is found. Prepare an emergency patch release.

description: Backend developers are significantly over-allocated (120-154% utilization), leading to high risk of burnout, reduced code quality, and cascading delays across all backend-dependent tasks.
mitigation_strategy: Hire one contract Senior Backend Developer for the project duration to absorb tasks like TASK-026 (MongoDB) and TASK-030 (PDK).
contingency_plan: De-scope the PDK deliverable (TASK-030) to a future release. Shift all non-critical path tasks from Sprint 1/2 to a new Sprint 5, extending the timeline.
monitoring_trigger: Weekly review of burndown charts and developer feedback.
resolution_timeline: 2 weeks to source and onboard contractor.
